cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Each of you is courageous, gallant, fearless, chivalrous, noble, and invincible. There is no war we won't win and no fight that we will back down from. We are House Whitaker!”
—Conrad Whitaker[/i]

cards.rules_text: Heir—You've created seven or more tokens this game. [i](If this card is your chosen heir in your sanctum, you may replace a draw with this card if you've met its condition.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The succession crisis left Houses shattered, civilians murdered, and Dewold in shambles.[/i]
[i]A mysterious stranger asked for a single head and the mirrorkin were eager to please.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Heir—Your opponents have been dealt combat damage by unblocked creatures five or more times this game. [i](If this card is your chosen heir in your sanctum, you may replace a draw with this card if you've met its condition. Each creature counts separately.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]In the mists of the Geistwald, dangers lurk unheard and unseen.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Deception {2}{U}{U} [i]({2}{U}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)[/i]
As long as it's your turn, Marilye is a 3/2 Elf Rogue creature with hexproof and indestructible.
[+1]: Tap target permanent. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
[-2]: Exile the top five cards of target opponent's library. You may cast any number of cards exiled this way with total mana value equal to or less than the amount of damage dealt to them this turn without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“If you think this will stop me, you clearly haven't been paying attention.”
—Wulfric Hook[/i]

cards.rules_text: Heir—You've cast five or more spells for an amount of mana less than their mana value. [i](If this card is your chosen heir in your sanctum, you may replace a draw with this card if you've met its condition.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Bennet had no use for an illegitimate son, but his heart did not allow for infanticide.[/i]

[i]“Dewold can burn. Nothing is left for me here.”
—Waldemar [/i]
[i]It strikes with a hero's resolve and a hangman's mercy.[/i]

cards.special_text2:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life and Waldemar's owner draws a card.
[-1]: Discard a card. If you didn't discard a nonland card this way, Waldemar's owner creates a tapped Treasure token.
[-2]: Sacrifice a non-Waldemar permanent.

cards.rules_text: Heir—You have twenty or more cards in exile. [i](If this card is your chosen heir in your sanctum, you may replace a draw with this card if you've met its condition.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The empty throne of House Phyre tempts many would be aspiring nobility. None have succeeded.[/i]
[i]The plane shook and the Houses each fell in line. Waldemar's only claim was faltered. Leon had won.[/i]

[i]“The mighty have no need to concern themselves with the concerns of the pitiful.”
—Sighilde Radcliff[/i]

cards.rules_text: Heir—You control six or more lands and you don't control any nonbasic lands and there aren't any nonbasic lands in your graveyard. [i](If this card is your chosen heir in your sanctum, you may replace a draw with this card if you've met its condition.)[/i]

Whenever a token enters from your reserves, put a +1/+1 counter and your choice of a trample, vigilance, or reach counter on it.
[+1]: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens in your reserves. [i]({3}: Put up to three tokens from your reserves onto the battlefield. Activate only as a sorcery.)[/i]
[-7]: Create two white enchantment tokens named Intisuyu's Armies with “At the beginning of your end step, create a 1/1 white Solider creature token for each creature you control.”

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Y'know the toll, little Terrel. All must pay.”[/i]
[i]King Bennet was protected from every mortal threat. The Conqueror was no mere mortal.[/i]
[i]“Kings and advisors declare war, but it is the poor that must die.”[/i]
[i]At first, each of the Great Houses were stunned and shocked at their king's death. It only took hours before the infighting began.[/i]
[i]“It was mighty brave of you to travel through the Westoak by yourself.”[/i]

[i]“You thought us too timid to punish your wickedness. That was your second mistake.”
—Bistra Sapner, the Flourishing[/i]
[i]Messengers have an important task to deliver plans and packages, making them excellent targets for assassins.[/i]
[i]The wealth of the prestigious affords them guards and mercenaries that let them keep their lofty positions.[/i]
[i]“Do you think your petty house can stand up to the greatest of the Grand Houses?”[/i]

[i]“The Aciesblade is reacting to this child? How very strange.”
—Marilye[/i]
[i]As her conquest floundered, Suyay chose to let go of the reins of her people's fate.[/i]

[i]Peasants wish to have the wealth of nobles. Nobles wish to have the power of kings. 
Kings wish to live without regrets as peasants.[/i]
[i]“The job's not done until the ransom money comes in.”[/i]

[i]“My standards weren't high, yet you still failed to impress.”
—Minna Radcliff[/i]
[i]“Of course I know what Lyanna did last Tuesday. I heard she was down at the bar with Brandon...”[/i]
[i]The mirrorkin had no issue adapting to the rather stale form of the castle-goers.[/i]
[i]Marilye didn't care about the other planeswalkers involved. The rumored Aciesblade however...[/i]
[i]Slabmen have been called “monsters” and “crown dogs”. They resent the former, but none dare question the latter.[/i]

cards.card_name: Voyage to the End of the World
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Why wait in a stuffy castle, trying to play the courts for a few gold pieces? Go out on the sea and take it.”
—Elric Nye[/i]

[i]“Power needs more power to overcome. It never stops growing and is never satisfied.”
—Waldemar[/i]
[i]Larkin's hands trembled as tears fell down his face. He tried to plea, but it was his very own hands that plunged the knife into his throat.[/i]

[i]“Die. Die like the horrid animal you are.”
—Veceslav[/i]
[i]House Durant and House Jardine once challenged House Radcliff for supremacy. Only House Radcliff remains. [/i]

[i]“Wars won based purely on numbers alone? How entirely graceless.”
—Capac Suyay[/i]
[i]House Hook doesn't wait for an answer.[/i]

[i]“A life without love isn't really a life at all.”
—Edith Rey[/i]

[i]“Never let your inner spark falter. Let it rage.”
—Minna Radcliff[/i]

[i]“Always make sure to cover your tracks. And explosions tend to cover a lot of ground.”
—Wystan Terrel[/i]
[i]Only the High King gets to meet face to face with the mysterious leader of House Turnberry.[/i]

[i]“Aim for the army, not the knights.”
—Clotilde Banefort[/i]
[i]“I had thought the injury would keep me away. But in times as dire as this, I will return.”[/i]
[i]With one blow, Caryl shattered stone and silence alike. House Rey would not be challenged again so soon.[/i]
[i]They don't rest. They don't move on. They only linger, whispering names of those long forgotten.[/i]
[i]House Rivers funds the Travelcarts, helping those in need across all of Dewold, even in times of war.[/i]

[i]“You know, mother, just as well as I do,” spat Waldemar in Delora's direction, “that the crown should be mine. The title. The [/i]power[i]. So listen close: When a birthright is at stake, all concerns give way to that. Nothing is unjustifiable.”[/i]
[i]Between the monsters of the Geistwald and the bandits of Westoak, sometimes it is better to just stay home.[/i]

[i]“Bistra makes sure to keep notes on all of the Houses of Dewold. We must adapt to their advances in order to conquer their lands.”
—Ranulf Sapner[/i]
[i]“House Whitaker's armies speak for themselves. I need not boast.”[/i]
[i]Gosfridus led Leon to the Soul of Dewold and it gave a simple and clean answer: Leon was the rightful and true king.[/i]
[i]“My house is the mighty dragon, yet you still stand in my way?”[/i]
[i]When the Turnberries need an army, they only need to ask the Geistwald and it provides.[/i]
[i]Those who die under the call of Gosfridus Turnberry don't stay dead for long.[/i]
[i]Attwater tactics are useful against monsters and people.[/i]
[i]House Nye only has a thin veneer as being in charge of Dewold's shipping vessels. All know their true goal.[/i]
[i]An example of those who betray House Vance.[/i]
[i]A supposedly empty House with a loyal and devoted family.[/i]

[i]“My House is one of might and magic.”
—Minna Radcliff[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]House Nye's warships are paraded around the kingdom, showcasing their nautical power.[/i]
[i]The most prized possessions are passed down from parent to child.[/i]
[i]“In House Terrel, I see greatness beyond my own petty life.”[/i]

[i]“A grim future filled where the land itself chokes out the roots of each of the trees.”
—Hexer Prophecy[/i]
[i]As the king's body floated down the Cherry River, the crown was placed on Leon's head.[/i]
[i]Delora offered Alder two options: Serve as her warsworn or denounce their lineage.[/i]
[i]“A soul is just mana wearing a different name. Come now, let's power this House.”[/i]
[i]Capac Suyay required very little time nor effort to “annex” the peaceful House Banefort. The Aciesblade would be hers.[/i]
[i]“Only at the Delta can you be assured to get imperfect information for the highest cost.”[/i]
[i]Before it was destroyed, House Phyre took care of the realm's bounties. Even without their leader, those who follow the house still uphold their duty.[/i]

[i]“The lengths these people go to prove their petty loyalty.”
—Waldemar[/i]

[i]“Remember who you serve. Your life will not be in vain.”
—Bennet Terrel[/i]

[i]“If you want to use a hammer, go with House Hook. If you want it done with finesse, you chose the right House.”
—Fleta Plaskett[/i]
[i]“They will never know my name and never sing my praises—but House Vance will endure, and that is enough.”[/i]
[i]House Sapner cultivates the Cherrywood Forest into a place of peace, respect, and a showing of their own sovereignty.[/i]

[i]“They enter our lands, stomping on our soil, yet expect us to bow?”
—Ranulf Sapner[/i]

[i]“The dragons roar and mortals tremble.”
—Minna Radcliff[/i]
[i]“And so the Sword of Perle took out her sword and thrust it into the mockery's chest, saving the day once more!”[/i]
[i]A prepared House is a strong House.[/i]
[i]Leon called upon the Houses to trust in his birthright and entered the Geistwald, leaving the Aciesblade completely alone.[/i]
[i]Marilye just needed an in to King's Rock. Luckily House Nye provided a boat.[/i]

[i]“Our army is one unending, unstoppable force.”
—Conrad Whitaker[/i]
[i]House Sapner keeps records from as grand as the lineage of the King to each season's rainfall.[/i]
[i]“We've got more time than you've got fingers.”[/i]
[i]“You entered my chamber as a no one. You will exit as one of House Sapner.”[/i]
[i]“House Perle never surrenders in the face of a challenge!”[/i]
[i]“Don't be afraid—getting lost is the fun part. I know all the best hiding spots. . . let me show you.”[/i]
[i]“Kirsa, Renodet, Dena, and Linley... All great warriors throughout the ages. Their stories are what keep me going.”[/i]
[i]While Ardleby Hold may be abandoned, the stragglers of House Phyre still maintain the surrounding forest.[/i]
[i]House Banefort fights a paradoxical war: they kill only for peace.[/i]
[i]A missing shipment, a broken window, a whispered threat—by the time you realize House Vance is involved, you've already paid the price.[/i]

[i]“An obedient knight that never questions orders.”
—Gosfridus Turnberry[/i]
[i]Even though Lord Phyre perished many moons ago, there are those that invoke his name to instill fear. [/i]
[i]“In House Nye I see glimmers of gold and adventure.”[/i]
[i]“In House Vance, I see greatness and a way to achieve my potential.”[/i]

[i]“Everything requires sacrifice. Only when you are gone will people truly see what you achieved.”
—Wulfric Hook[/i]

[i]“You would oppose the Instisuyu, Marilye? Then you oppose a glorious empire.”
—Capac Suyay[/i]
[i]“Your rules don't apply inside these walls.[/i]

[i]“The Geistwald is never safe, no matter what preparations you make.”
—Roza Attwater[/i]
[i]The Geistwald holds many glades where ouphes stare into the endless sky, glancing at worlds of artifice, plague, and utmost peace.[/i]
[i]“Today, we stand. Today, we fight. Our lives for Lady Edith!”[/i]

[i]“Did you think yourself the hero of this story? The one that would save the day? Your name and house will perish.”
—Petula Vance[/i]
[i]With House Vance's lead, Waldemar studied and learned, hoping to one day usurp House Terrel and take his rightful place on the throne.[/i]
[i]“A Plaskett never bargains for what they can just as easily steal.”[/i]
[i]“In House Rey, I see respect for all and a way around the petty wars.”[/i]

[i]“House Rey remembers all, from the grandest slight to the smallest favor.”
—Edith Rey[/i]
[i]“In House Sapner, I see a way above the petty squabbles of the other houses.”[/i]

[i]“Remember that with all of my heart, I love you. When this petty squabble is over, I will rejoin you back home.”
—Last in the letters to Bryanna[/i]
[i]“Be willing to die for your lord. Only then will greatness shine its light on you and your house.”[/i]

[i]“Only by looking forward can you forget all the bodies that you left behind.”
—Wulfric Hook[/i]
[i]Before you prove yourself on the battlefield, a Terrel recruit is just another casualty.[/i]
[i]Throughout the Westoak Forest, House Banefort has makeshift encampments to heal any wounded soldiers that are on long treks.[/i]
[i]The fae of House Rivers prefer to work their magic unseen, but there's always a time for blades and witnesses.[/i]

[i]“Never let subtlety obstruct a powerful delivery.”
—Ita Hook[/i]
[i]House Hook doesn't wait for an answer.[/i]

[i]“Act with care and back away. Just don't do the Hook way without a plan.”
—Dovizia Attwater[/i]
[i]A Plaskett assassin gets the job quickly and efficiently. A Vance assassin, however, leaves no trace that you were ever there.[/i]
[i]In the end, the strong get exactly what they want.[/i]

[i]“You want a hero to look to? Someone that will save the day? Become that hero. Lead your own destiny.”
—Fulchard Sapner[/i]

[i]“My armies don't need soldiers and swords. I have siege weapons.”
—Gosfridus Turnberry[/i]
[i]“Our battle will be remembered by the ages!”[/i]

[i]“I have no care for your crisis of succession. My House is capable on its own.”
—Bistra Sapner[/i]
[i]Once House Plaskett has put a price on your head, sleep never is safe.[/i]
[i]An out of place courier delivering an unknown warning to a unsuspecting people.[/i]
